Review_Text: Buen teléfono

Phone is cheaply made. I dropped the phone barely chufy and the screen broke this is my second phone has my first one the screen cracked as well. IPhones can survive a drop off a damn 10-story building but this Samsung phone can't even survive a two foot drop. It is a very sad and disappointing product from such a a so-called great company. Do not buy stay away from this phone
El teléfono esta totalmente despegado de la pantalla de la carcaza , pareciera que la pila esta inflada , requiero cambio ya que no tiene ni un año de uso
Battery life.
Este teléfono no es compatible con ninguna línea disponible en los Estados Unidos y no me sirve .
fast delivery but it doesn't work with Sprint/T-mobile. The IMEI is not in their system. The phone goes back to the seller.
last year's model has all good features
Good phone
Very responssive
Not att user friendly will not purchase cell from amazon again. I'll go to manufacture.
When I order this there was nothing said that it could not be activated by my carrier due to the fact it was an international set and not supported by my carrier
No Network Connection 1 day after refund/return window closed. Product was definitely defective. Shouldn't need a new SIM Card reader after a month.
Samsung always doing their thing. Love their products
Muy buen producto, superó mis espectativas y tiene un buen precio.
Got it connected no problems so far

This was my first time (and the 2nd didn't fair any better) buying an unlocked phone from Amazon. I loved this phone, but it wouldn't work with Sprint, T-Mobile, AT&T, Spectrum or Cincinnati Bell. I would WARN anyone trying to do the unlocked phone thing to be VERY careful.
Great phone so far. My daughter uses it for games and seems fast and reliable.

THIS PHONE CAUGHT ON FIRE. I TOOK THE BACK OFF TO LOOK AT THE BATTERY .The phone gave a popping sound. I drop it to the floor. It was burning up. My aide ran in my room. " Quote (hurry let me take this outside it can blow up. }She got something to pick it up and went outside and throw it away on the concrete.
I only use this phone to check work email because I don’t want company app on my iPhone 12. This Samsung phone is about 30 seconds slower than my iPhone 12. Otherwise it’s ok.
When i get it i let you know then if i like it are not seem to me ever order i make to amazon past 4 months ever thing getting lost are delay for some reason.
For call, for message ,for video ,for music ,everything
Purchased on February 3 20 and won't charge now three months
Battery is really good . Long time
Works great and love the pictures that is nice and clear in this celler phone buy it .I love it .

Honestly nothing. Everything was.going fine with it until my guarantee ran out. Ive been having alot of problems charging the phone. And since a week not abĺe to charge it. Now im stuck with a 200$ phone that i cant used.
Only received an empty product box with charger and sd card so a scam.

Samsung androids might be the best. Although it is not the Flagship "S," the "A" is the best android platform I've experienced. The battery life is excellent, although my phone is fairly new (approximately 1month now). The resolution is excellent for it's current price. As is its sound quality. The aesthetic of Samsung's applications are very appealing.
Dont get it
Buen producto con una buana calidad,y responsabilidad al entregar .
Very good...I love the phone i dont normally like new phones with all the extra details hard for me to work but yes the phone is good the battery dont last as long as I'd like but It does last long.
Good phone for the money if you don't want all the bells and whistles. Does everything you need and battery life is very good. Camera is decent
Lo solicite liberado para enviarlo a otro país en la descripción no dice si es unlocked
Very pleased with fast delivery and product...only spanish instructions included could be an issue with some
My dad loves this phone . It’s a bit more modern for him with the finger print the back of phone which was an adjustment. But the phone has been great so far.

I'm really excited about the phone but I've yet to use it because it doesn't have a regular sim card. You have to poke like a needle in a very tiny hole. I don't have that because of my ms and the way my hand shakes. I personally don't like sharp or pointy things around me. I'm going to order a needle and try it so it should be working soon. I like the sharpness of the images.

I hate this phone. I have nothing bad to say about the seller, it arrived quickly and is what was promised. However, I find this phone absolutely maddening and have wanted to throw it or drop kick it so many times that I've lost count. The most annoying feature is it's accidental touch protection. If you set the phone down, like on a table, and you want to use it, you cannot. It will not respond to touch unless you pick it up. There is a place to turn it off in the settings, but it still does this even after you tell it not to. It is a large, heavy phone and I do not always want to hold it, I should be able to set it down and use it, but no. Accidental touch is not something I've ever even worried about with smart phones. I don't know why they felt it was a necessary feature. I used a Samsung Galaxy s6 edge for four years and switching to this phone was painful. I'm comparison, this phone is a cheap pos. I really like the Google sky map app, it won't work on this phone. After about a month of use, it's decided it doesn't work inside my house. All calls are garbled and it drops most of them. It frequently loses connection to the network when outside of the home as well. I would give it zero stars if possible. I wish I understood the difference between the s model and the a model before purchasing because I would not have bought this phone. It's become so useless after a little over a month of use that I've broken down and spent the money for an s9. I would have just bought one in the first place if I knew how cheaply made this one .was.
One week after purchasing, the internal mic stopped working. I couldn't send voicenotes and when I made a call, the person on the other end couldn't hear me.
Wasn’t compatible my company
The clock was wrong and I can’t put the alarm, the location not work properly was waste of money
tres bon produit
Decent phone but not kid friendly. Charger port can be easily broken. Make sure it's not forced or bent, when plugged into the charger.
Product was exactly as described, arrived when it was supposed to & without damage
Very nice phone
Awesome device

I tried to give them a benefit of doubt until I turned on my "supposedly" new phone. There was still pictures on the drive, the charger they had with it was not one you connect to the wall, but they gave a cheap generic charger... There was no sims cards with it. I am going try to post some pics to show you proof.
Perfect! Was for my grandma and it did the job.
Absolutely beautiful phone, brand new. Fingerprint reader is amazing and battery life is unreal 3 days plus.

I have had nothing but problems since I had this phone. I am in the process of trying to find me another one. It keep losing connections! I have been to the "store" three times to get it fixed. I had a hard time getting all my information to transfer from my old phone. It just stop letting me send or receive pictures through my emails. Now my bluetooth keeps going in and out. Will not stay connected. Still can't set up voice mail! It seems like it's there, but can't retrieve them. My first and last Samsung. Thank You

Screen kept going black and the camera took pics that looked like xrays. My mum just needed talk and text so that didn’t really bother us but screen blacking out constantly did, multiple people in the household tried to get it to work. Maybe just a bad one but my mum needs a reliable phone.
It's a well balanced phone and came as advertised.

This phone is slow as heck. it takes a while just for it to load the unlock screen when it is already turned on. having more than one app open in the background makes the phone freeze. the only good thing is the camera... and its not great.
Love it! Great video quality and sound.
It was a good price but it was tough to get going and then transfer all my data. I still don't have all of my voicemails.

This phone is wonderful I would buy another before I travel. This phone was for my nine-year-old and it’s unbelievable it’s better than my iPhone 11 you can search the web and watch YouTube videos at the same time how cool is that.
My friends that have iPhones say the camera is much clearer on this model than theirs, it fits in your hand nicely.
Orijinal

Barely CAN$200 with taxes included, this phone is a steal. It has virtually everything you'd expect for a modern smartphone. Works quickly, has a moderate amount of stock space, the camera is decent; the one low-point may be the speaker which isn't that impressive. An improvement over its similar predecessor the A10, this A10-S includes a fingerprint scanner which works great, as well as an improved location for the speaker (on the bezel of the phone instead of on the back which was easily muffled) — yet, it's priced almost identically to its predecessor. I will say one thing, I first bought a "defective" A10S and had to return it for a replacement, but I wasn't even sure if it was a one-off defect until I bought another one which didn't end up having the problem. The issue I had was that the touch screen was less responsive along the side edges of the screen, so when I tried to press keys like "P", or "L", or the backspace button it didn't always respond to my touch. The top pull-down menu also didn't work when the phone was flat. I thought it might have just been something I had to deal with because of the economical value of the phone, but it WAS a defect. If your A10S has this problem, return it for another one because that's not supposed to happen. Overall, if you're not someone who needs to have the latest most expensive Iphone and just needs a good phone that works and has all the features you need.... save yourself about $800 and buy this phone. It's an excellent value.

I had already purchased this phone and was very happy with it and would have given it 4 stars (camera is just OK) but I dropped it and the glass was shattered. I clicked on the "buy it again" button on my order page expecting to get the same phone. I did not. It looked the same but there were important differences. The first clue that something was wrong was the adapters in the box which were not compatible with any electrical outlet I have. Next, after transferring all my data I noticed several unusual things. Any app that spoke had a british accent (which I didn't mind, but seemed odd). My weather app is set to 24 hour time and no matter how often I change it to 12 hour, it always reverts back to 24 hour. The dates on my email are listed as day/month/year so that March 20th would read 20/3/20. I then discovered an insert in the instructions informing me that the phone was from India and should be activated with a sim card issued in India. If I used a sim issued from another region the phone might not function properly. I live in Pennsylvania and that is where my sim card was issued. I called customer service, explained the situation and they sent me a new phone, assuring me that my experience was a mistake that would not happen again. My 2nd new phone came, again with the weird adapters and sure enough, a card that said the phone was an Indian phone to be activated with a sim card issued in India. That phone is also going back and I have ordered a completely different phone. Read the phone description carefully before purchasing. If it says International phone, do not order it!

Many dual SIM phones have only two card slots, one for a SIM and one that can be used for either a second SIM or a microSD card, but not both. This phone has three slots in its card tray, two for nano SIMs plus a dedicated microSD slot, so no sacrifice is necessary. Has an FM radio chip and includes wired ear buds to use as an antenna. Minimal bloatware, only thing I'd like to delete but can't is Facebook. Flashlight is super bright but only has one brightness level, 100%, unlike my previous Samsung which had four. No magnetic compass sensor, which is no biggie with GPS or if you can determine heading from the sun, moon, and time. No NFC so no support for contactless payment. Speaker location on the bottom edge to the left of the Micro USB port is unfortunate... my natural operating mode is left handed using the thumb to type and little finger to balance the phone, which blocks the speaker. Speaker is also blocked if I hold the phone against my body to stabilize. Speaker is plenty loud and sounds great. Wish it had a USB Type C port and quick charging capability. Display is very sharp, plenty bright. Software supports pretty much any language on the planet... at first turn-on, Español is the default, so pull down to US English if that's your preference. Easy peasy. No problems getting it to work on Metro by T-Mobile... just have to register the IMEI through one of their flirty customer service call center reps, who will waive the $15 fee if you go that route instead of taking it to a store. Had I asked for her number, she probably would have shot back with 611 LOL! Anyway, love the glossy red finish. 2 GB is a little light these days, but I've always used lower end phones so knowing how to minimize RAM footprint is second nature. No problems yet. Overall, not disappointed. I would buy again.

I like the finger print recogition and the feature that you can add multiple finger prints, so I have both my left and right index fingers set up to operate the device. The phone turns on from the side, but also if you place your finger on the reader in the rear, which is a natural way to hold the phone, it's turns on right away. I haven't set up the facial recognition so I can't comment on that. Using the Samsung APP "Smart Switch", all my data and APPs transferred to the new phone. I did have to log back in to the APP accounts on the new phone, which was a good safety feature, in my opinion, in case someone where to do it without your knowledge, they wouldn't have immediate access to your information/accounts. I am very happy with this purchase.

I purchased this phone for the express purpose of having a higher version of Android so that I could control two GoPro cameras and other video equipment that my trusty Galaxy 5 could not. I quickly found that it was in Spanish and no amount of trying, for more than a week, proved successful in changing the language. The initial Commence page totally failed to respond to any taps, tap and hold or swipes or system resets.. I eventually called Amazon Support and got a wonderful rep; unfortunately she could not resolve the issue. I was on the verge of returning the phone when one night it magically advanced to the first screen of set up, in Spanish. I am fluent in French so could understand some words and eventually advanced. The next stumbling block was Google insisting I set up a new G Mail account, with no opt out, and no way to use my current Google account. After several days I finally arrived at a screen where I could change the language. I was, at last, able to set everything to my preferences. Quite a very long haul but worth the effort. The phone performs exactly the way I wanted it to and there have been no more issues. I noticed other buyers have encountered language problems with the initial drop down "Change Language" failing to work. IF you have the patience and perseverance you'll hit your goal. Delivery was very fast, and, need I say I do not back off from challenges! Be aware: A10s [Spanish] A10e [English].

Will be returning it.

I don't really write reviews. This is my first long review. I spent countless hours trying to find a budget Friendly Quality phone. The camera quality is pretty great in (good lighting). I like that it has portrait mode. This phone is not small, it is just Slim but I have a phone case & screen protector. The screen is big and pretty. Ive had this phone about 2-3 months & hace dropped possibly over a handful of times and no cracks. Sound quality is okay, not the Loudest. The battery is good, it can last all day Maybe two depending on phone usage. Im on my phone frequently and last me all day if full charge. It can also take a while to charge. If you live in the U.S. you may have to call your phone carrier customer line or in store to activate your IMEI to their Network in order to get phone service. I wasted about 2 days trying to do it myself 🤦🏽‍♀️ when i couldve just called customer Service and got it activated in less than 5-10 minutes. Also this phone is compatible with MOST GSM carriers NOT all, (Ex. Metro PCS, T-Mobile). It is not compatible with CDMA carriers (Ex. Verizon, Sprint). It tells us in the description box. Most importantly review the company reviews you plan to purchase the phone from so you can have an idea of what youre getting yourself into. All in all I am highly satisfied with my phone.

If you want a phone that is easy to use, clear sound, beautiful pictures , stylish AND tough, great battery life and is AFFORDABLE, this is the phone for you. When my Galaxy J3 finally threw in the towel, I tried some new fangled phones, off brands promising better! Faster! Greater! Bigger!! They weren't. They blacked out, quit working for no reason, sounded bad, wouldn't charge, ... so I did what I should have done in the first place... I purchased another Samsung Galaxy Phone. I upgraded my J3 (which I dropped more times than I can remember, and in water at least 30 times😳 before it finally developed a glitch🤣) to this. NOTHING beats a Samsung Galaxy phone. They're easy to use, good cameras, excellent screen area , clear, sharp, vibrant. And tough enough. I'm hard on phones. Galaxy can take it. This is the first time I've tried an international version, and with double Sim capabilities. I turned this phone on , set it on English, put in my AT&T pre paid Sim card i had used in two of the POS phones, and that was it .. no problems at all. This Galaxy phone was well worth the money, as was my Galaxy.phone before it. It has everything that I need and then some. And at an awesome price. I dont live on my phone like a lot of folks do. But I want to be able to count on it when I need to. I wasted somewhere between four and six hundred dollars on crappie POS phones(and one with a service plan I could never quite use). They promise everything and delivered nothing. I will not make that mistake again.

I like the finger print recogition and the feature that you can add multiple finger prints, so I have both my left and right index fingers set up to operate the device. The phone turns on from the side, but also if you place your finger on the reader in the rear, which is a natural way to hold the phone, it's turns on right away. I haven't set up the facial recognition so I can't comment on that. Using the Samsung APP "Smart Switch", all my data and APPs transferred to the new phone. I did have to log back in to the APP accounts on the new phone, which was a good safety feature, in my opinion, in case someone where to do it without your knowledge, they wouldn't have immediate access to your information/accounts. I am very happy with this purchase.

I had already purchased this phone and was very happy with it and would have given it 4 stars (camera is just OK) but I dropped it and the glass was shattered. I clicked on the "buy it again" button on my order page expecting to get the same phone. I did not. It looked the same but there were important differences. The first clue that something was wrong was the adapters in the box which were not compatible with any electrical outlet I have. Next, after transferring all my data I noticed several unusual things. Any app that spoke had a british accent (which I didn't mind, but seemed odd). My weather app is set to 24 hour time and no matter how often I change it to 12 hour, it always reverts back to 24 hour. The dates on my email are listed as day/month/year so that March 20th would read 20/3/20. I then discovered an insert in the instructions informing me that the phone was from India and should be activated with a sim card issued in India. If I used a sim issued from another region the phone might not function properly. I live in Pennsylvania and that is where my sim card was issued. I called customer service, explained the situation and they sent me a new phone, assuring me that my experience was a mistake that would not happen again. My 2nd new phone came, again with the weird adapters and sure enough, a card that said the phone was an Indian phone to be activated with a sim card issued in India. That phone is also going back and I have ordered a completely different phone. Read the phone description carefully before purchasing. If it says International phone, do not order it!

I hate this phone. I have nothing bad to say about the seller, it arrived quickly and is what was promised. However, I find this phone absolutely maddening and have wanted to throw it or drop kick it so many times that I've lost count. The most annoying feature is it's accidental touch protection. If you set the phone down, like on a table, and you want to use it, you cannot. It will not respond to touch unless you pick it up. There is a place to turn it off in the settings, but it still does this even after you tell it not to. It is a large, heavy phone and I do not always want to hold it, I should be able to set it down and use it, but no. Accidental touch is not something I've ever even worried about with smart phones. I don't know why they felt it was a necessary feature. I used a Samsung Galaxy s6 edge for four years and switching to this phone was painful. I'm comparison, this phone is a cheap pos. I really like the Google sky map app, it won't work on this phone. After about a month of use, it's decided it doesn't work inside my house. All calls are garbled and it drops most of them. It frequently loses connection to the network when outside of the home as well. I would give it zero stars if possible. I wish I understood the difference between the s model and the a model before purchasing because I would not have bought this phone. It's become so useless after a little over a month of use that I've broken down and spent the money for an s9. I would have just bought one in the first place if I knew how cheaply made this one .was.

If you want a phone that is easy to use, clear sound, beautiful pictures , stylish AND tough, great battery life and is AFFORDABLE, this is the phone for you. When my Galaxy J3 finally threw in the towel, I tried some new fangled phones, off brands promising better! Faster! Greater! Bigger!! They weren't. They blacked out, quit working for no reason, sounded bad, wouldn't charge, ... so I did what I should have done in the first place... I purchased another Samsung Galaxy Phone. I upgraded my J3 (which I dropped more times than I can remember, and in water at least 30 times😳 before it finally developed a glitch🤣) to this. NOTHING beats a Samsung Galaxy phone. They're easy to use, good cameras, excellent screen area , clear, sharp, vibrant. And tough enough. I'm hard on phones. Galaxy can take it. This is the first time I've tried an international version, and with double Sim capabilities. I turned this phone on , set it on English, put in my AT&T pre paid Sim card i had used in two of the POS phones, and that was it .. no problems at all. This Galaxy phone was well worth the money, as was my Galaxy.phone before it. It has everything that I need and then some. And at an awesome price. I dont live on my phone like a lot of folks do. But I want to be able to count on it when I need to. I wasted somewhere between four and six hundred dollars on crappie POS phones(and one with a service plan I could never quite use). They promise everything and delivered nothing. I will not make that mistake again.

Many dual SIM phones have only two card slots, one for a SIM and one that can be used for either a second SIM or a microSD card, but not both. This phone has three slots in its card tray, two for nano SIMs plus a dedicated microSD slot, so no sacrifice is necessary. Has an FM radio chip and includes wired ear buds to use as an antenna. Minimal bloatware, only thing I'd like to delete but can't is Facebook. Flashlight is super bright but only has one brightness level, 100%, unlike my previous Samsung which had four. No magnetic compass sensor, which is no biggie with GPS or if you can determine heading from the sun, moon, and time. No NFC so no support for contactless payment. Speaker location on the bottom edge to the left of the Micro USB port is unfortunate... my natural operating mode is left handed using the thumb to type and little finger to balance the phone, which blocks the speaker. Speaker is also blocked if I hold the phone against my body to stabilize. Speaker is plenty loud and sounds great. Wish it had a USB Type C port and quick charging capability. Display is very sharp, plenty bright. Software supports pretty much any language on the planet... at first turn-on, Español is the default, so pull down to US English if that's your preference. Easy peasy. No problems getting it to work on Metro by T-Mobile... just have to register the IMEI through one of their flirty customer service call center reps, who will waive the $15 fee if you go that route instead of taking it to a store. Had I asked for her number, she probably would have shot back with 611 LOL! Anyway, love the glossy red finish. 2 GB is a little light these days, but I've always used lower end phones so knowing how to minimize RAM footprint is second nature. No problems yet. Overall, not disappointed. I would buy again.

I don't really write reviews. This is my first long review. I spent countless hours trying to find a budget Friendly Quality phone. The camera quality is pretty great in (good lighting). I like that it has portrait mode. This phone is not small, it is just Slim but I have a phone case & screen protector. The screen is big and pretty. Ive had this phone about 2-3 months & hace dropped possibly over a handful of times and no cracks. Sound quality is okay, not the Loudest. The battery is good, it can last all day Maybe two depending on phone usage. Im on my phone frequently and last me all day if full charge. It can also take a while to charge. If you live in the U.S. you may have to call your phone carrier customer line or in store to activate your IMEI to their Network in order to get phone service. I wasted about 2 days trying to do it myself 🤦🏽‍♀️ when i couldve just called customer Service and got it activated in less than 5-10 minutes. Also this phone is compatible with MOST GSM carriers NOT all, (Ex. Metro PCS, T-Mobile). It is not compatible with CDMA carriers (Ex. Verizon, Sprint). It tells us in the description box. Most importantly review the company reviews you plan to purchase the phone from so you can have an idea of what youre getting yourself into. All in all I am highly satisfied with my phone.

It is a Christmas present so I'm only rating for what I can see. I'll update later after the person gets and uses it for a little bit, so I can say Truthfully the likes/dislikes(if any). First!! I got it Super Fast! The protection filler ( for lack of a better word ), could have been a little better! It has 2 (what I call blow up pillows) One was deflated the other one was fine, but in my opinion 2 is not good enough even on regular days, much less Christmas time where things are super crazy and not handled with the best of care!( I used to work in a Post Office! AND delivered mail bags/packages to other Post Offices! SO I KNOW WHAT I'M TALKING ABOUT)! That being said, when I opened the package the Phone box was in pristine condition! The phone has a heavy feel to it. And that is Great by me. I hope it means it can take a beating until she picks out a case for it.LOL. The screen is a lot bigger than what she has now and bigger than I thought it would be! She has " fingerprint reader " on her phone now and loves it so I think I hit it out the park with fingerprint And face recognition!! I'm giving the Phone 5 stars for what I can tell as of now. Like I said I will update a little later. UPDATE: Longer than a couple of weeks ( sorry ). I have to say this is an Awesome phone!!! It is so much better than I was expecting for the price. And she has even dropped it a few times ( before she got a phone case for it ), and no damage at all!! I was floored to say the least! I expected a cracked screen or something, but nothing. So if you want a phone that has it all (in my opinion), great volume, nice feel, AND you don't have to worry about being gentle with it, then all I can say is "I don't think you'll go wrong buying this one" . I know I'm very grateful I did.
